you
[Music]
hi and welcome you listening to the x-22
report my name is Dave and this is
episode 1387 a and today's date is
September 26 2017 and the top of the
episode is the economy is unwinding not
the Fed balance sheet let's get into the
economic collapse financial news now
we've been talking about how the central
bank's government's they've been trying
to control the crypto market this is
their endgame to control everything
about it and out in Sweden what we see
is that the Swedish government they are
now testing crypto currencies now the
government bankers across the world
believe that this has the potential to
replace cash and make other payment
system more efficient so Sweden's
central bank is taking a serious look at
Bitcoin now cash use in Sweden is
plummeting right now and the amount of
currency that is in circulation is
dwindling and they're looking to
experiment with crypto currency now
again they're gonna want to control it
they're not gonna want this to be an
open decentralized system they want to
make sure that they can control
everything about it and this is why we
have a lot of different banks the UBS
and many others and the central banks
that are trying to create their own type
of coin which they would control and say
listen we've stabilized it we've made it
so it doesn't fluctuate you can get out
of Bitcoin you can get out of the other
cryptocurrencies and move into ours and
it looks like this is what they're
trying to do now out in Sweden the
Rick's Bank they estimate that the cash
transactions made up only of around 15%
of all retail transactions last year the
number is down from 40% in 2010 thanks
in large part to the massively popular
mobile payment type of system and
they're looking at this saying you know
maybe we should move into maybe Bitcoin
or something else and implement it in
Sweden and completely move everything in
that direction because eventually what's
going to happen they want everything to
go electronic here in the United States
we see the economy is still falling
apart
consumer confidence well that has
dropped it looks like the American
public is losing faith in the stock
market they don't believe the stock
market anymore even though it's
continually bobbing up and down right
now where it's also hitting all-time new
highs they're looking at it and say well
wait a minute the corporate earnings
those are manipulated the corporations
are buying back their stocks their
actual sales revenue coming in does not
exist the valuation of all these
companies well some of them are a little
odd and it looks like we've seen this
back in the dot-com bubble in 2008 and
people are looking at it right now
saying you know I really don't believe
this anymore now if we look at the sp500
it has closed at a new record high 37
times so far this year now this is the
most in the first quarter at the third
quarter period since 1997 when the S&P
closed at a new record 40 times before
the start of the fourth quarter and when
you look at this you say hmm this is
kind of odd is this really something
that can happen we've seen it happen
many times before but every time it has
happened guess what occurred a recession
and it looks like we're heading in that
direction we see Case Shiller well
they're out with their new home prices
saying that they're growing at the
fastest pace in three years they hit an
all-time new record high and what's very
interesting about this is now we are
above the point of the housing bubble
back in 2008 we are now above that point
and if you really look at the Case
Shiller 20-city index you're on year
well it really hasn't gone anywhere it's
pretty much flat line now let's take
what Case Shiller just told us that
housing prices are moving up there
they're growing at a very fast pace but
when we look at what is really happening
in home sales it just doesn't make sense
once again pending home sales new home
sales existing home sales they are all
down now we saw this in July
we saw it in August here we are in
September and August well it's coming in
that yes sales are down once again and
this does not look good now they thought
there was going to be a 2.5 percent gain
but they're down 3.4% this is huge so
what is happening here is that the
housing market is completely falling
apart now what's very interesting is
that we know that we had a hurricane in
Texas we had one in Florida we know that
Puerto Rico the people are really
suffering down there there's no water
electric it is a complete disaster and
what the Census Bureau does is if the
agencies don't report in they and they
don't have any sales information they
just say okay everything is unchanged
we'll just leave everything the way it
is now we know because of what has
happened in Texas in Florida people
didn't go out and they didn't purchase
any new homes so we know that sales are
much much lower than what they're
reporting but since no sales have been
reported they just say things are
unchanged now let's take this one step
further case-shiller in the 20 cities is
telling us how great everything is and
prices are increasing we see new homes
petting homes existing homes completely
imploding on themselves and then we see
that demand is down for all three types
of mortgages mortgages eligible for
guarantees by the government-sponsored
enterprises such as Fannie Mae and
Freddie Mac well we know these are
funded by the taxpayers well these are
down and when we look at this we can see
that why are these down because the
everyday American person is not going
out and they're not purchasing these
homes now there was a survey that was
conducted and it's conducted quarterly
it tallied responses from the senior
executives at 190 mortgage lenders from
the largest banks to the smaller
specialty lenders to assess their views
in Outlook across a very dimensions
of the mortgage market these executives
reported that demand over the past three
months has dropped to a year-over-year
for purchase mortgages reaching the
lowest third quarter reading in the past
two years lenders also reported that
they refinancing those mortgages they
are also down so when Case Shiller comes
out and tells us how great everything in
is and prices are rising why are all
these sales down why are the lenders
saying that people are not going out and
you know buying the houses through
mortgages and why now since there's a
lack of demand at these lenders why are
they loosening their lending standards
to bring more people in this is what we
see when the banks want to push out more
debt we saw in the automobile industry
when they finished with all those
individuals that had you know good or
medium credit they went down to the poor
credit down to the subprime then down to
the sub subprime because what happens is
they can't bring people in to push the
debt out so they have to go down to the
next level and this ends up to be a
problem as we saw back in 2008 so the
housing market right now is not going as
well as the corporate media is reporting
or the Fed is reporting or the
government is reporting yes you're gonna
have still some hot areas but the rest
of the country they're feeling the pain
now the Fed cash carry he's out there
and this is the manipulates fad
president Neel Kashkari he's saying that
there is no evidence that there's a
problem with inflation he said when I
look at the economy I don't see any
signs that the economy is close to
overheating now we know that Yellen came
out and told us that we're not going to
see any type of economic crisis in our
lifetime we have carryout they're
telling us that he doesn't see a problem
with inflation you see
overheating and we heard this before
back in 2008 before the recession where
they weren't forecasting any type of
recession the real estate market is
contained the subprime securities
contained and AIG will only need one
bailout well coming out of the Fed
documentation it looks like the Fed
chair Janet Yellen openly admitted that
the Fed does not fully understand
inflation and then just this morning
Yellen stated that the Fed was wrong
with employment and inflation now
remember this is the Fed we're talking
about the group of these group of
individuals that are supposed to be
running the country financially and
they're telling us they don't understand
employment they don't understand
inflation the question is why don't they
understand this well they do understand
it they understand they're manipulating
all the numbers they understand that the
government is manipulating all the
numbers they realize that all this
manipulation has thrown everything off I
mean they knew there was a recession
coming in 2008 they knew they were gonna
pull the plug
they know exactly what was happening
just because they're not telling you
doesn't mean they don't know the same
things happening right now
they understand that inflation well the
whole thing starting to heat up this is
why they're putting out the message that
everything is fine they always do this
before everything starts to fall apart
and that's what we're seeing right now
now there was a new study that backs up
a theory that many Americans have long
suspected the u.s. is no longer the land
of opportunity despite what the National
Statistics would have us believe in the
corporate media out there telling us
that yes this is true
now this research comes from the
economic innovation group the EIG and
this is a bipartisan public policy
organization funded by successful tech
entrepreneurs the study provides
detailed data on the economically
distressed communities that
fundamentally changed the economic
landscape of America now some of the key
findings from the groundbreaking study
are the following 53 million individuals
one in six Americans live in an
economically distressed zip code
prosperous if codes are home to eighty
four point eight million people more
than any other of the five peers of
communities more than half of the
country's population living in distress
zip codes resides in the south a quarter
of the distressed population is under 18
years of age meaning roughly 13 million
American children are growing up in
communities which likely have a deeply
negative neighborhood effect in the
average distress zip codes more than a
quarter of the population lives in
poverty and over 40% of prime age adults
are missing from the workforce and 58
percent of adults in distress of codes
have no education beyond high school and
one of the most disturbing findings is
that the so called economic recovery has
been a cruel allusion to a large swath
of the US and they're saying that the
United States is no longer the land of
opportunity only certain areas only
certain individuals have this
opportunity and we can see that the
landscape of the United States has
changed completely over the years where
a lot of the wealth has been siphoned up
to the 1% and the rest of the country is
working one to three part-time jobs
trying to make ends meet lost their
high-paying job either got laid off or
fired never could define another job
that they had and we can see this has
been going on for a very long time I
just saw the other day this dirty old
man he says he works two part-time jobs
he just went to another interview and
there wasn't I mean he's trying to get a
full-time job and again he was rejected
and he's still trying to make ends meet
with these two part-time jobs still
trying to get a full-time job and this
is happening to many individuals across
the country
I could see why the people are sitting
here scratching their head saying what
is going on because everyone right now
is suffering everyone is trying to get
by everyone's trying to make ends meet
and a lot of people and we can see from
all the information that we've been
receiving is that they've been running
up their credit cards just to try to
make ends meet this is the last stage of
an economy where the people of the
economy
well they suffer for it and this is how
the central banking system is developed
because they siphon away all the wealth
at the very end and this is exactly what
we're seeing right now listen everyone
thanks a lot for listening be well be
safe and especially be prepared thanks a
lot
